description: Numbers n such that pi(n) divides n.
comments: Each cluster of entries is approximately a power of e from the previous cluster.
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..296
Konstantinos N. Gaitanas, An explicit formula for the prime counting function, arXiv preprint arXiv:1311.1398, 2013
example: 120 is a member as there are exactly 30 primes less than 120 and 30 * 4 = 120.
mathematica: Select[ Range[2, 10^5], IntegerQ[ # / PrimePi[ # ]] & ]Select[Range[1000], Divisible[#, PrimePi[#]] &] (* Requires version 6.0+. _Alonso del Arte_, May 24 2015 *)
crossrefs: Apart from initial term same as A058011.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 07 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Nov 08 2000
